author: sheldog
title: Re: Judge Orders Steve Bannon to Jail by July 1 for Contempt of Congress
text:
Former Donald Trump adviser Steve Bannon will report to prison on July 1 to serve a four-month sentence for contempt of Congress for defying subpoenas from the January 6 select committee.
NEW fromâ€” Raheem. (@RaheemKassam)
[@thenatpulse]: BREAKING: Steve Bannon Must Report to Jail by July 1, Says Judge.
Former Trump advisor Stephen K. Bannon, ......
READ ON:
 [June 6, 2024]
NBC News
reports:
A federal judge on Thursday ordered former Trump adviser Steve Bannon to report to prison on July 1 to begin a four-month prison sentence for defying subpoenas from the Jan. 6 Committee after a higher court rejected his appeal.
Bannon was found guilty on two counts of contempt of Congress in July 2022 for defying the committeeâ€™s subpoenas, but his sentence had been put on hold while he appealed the case. U.S. District Judge Carl said Thursday he did not believe that the â€œoriginal basisâ€ for his stay of the imposition of Bannon's sentence existed any longer after an appeals court upheld Bannon's conviction. Bannon could still appeal Nicholâ€™s ruling that he must report to prison.
â€œâ€˜The defendant chose allegiance to Donald Trump over compliance with the law [sic],â€™" Assistant U.S. Attorney Molly Gastonâ€¦told jurors.â€ Thatâ€™s not going to sound so bad soon. The Jan. 6 Committee was an unlawful sham. Sentence ends before Election Day.â€” Joel Pollak (@joelpollak)
 [June 6, 2024]
Are we reading this correctly? Two counts of contempt of Congress? Do you know who else is currently in contempt of Congress?
Hunter Biden and Attorney General Merrick Garland.
This should concern more people.â€” Drew Holden (@DrewHolden360)
[pic.twitter.com/sgoIeDgHYT] [June 6, 2024]
Steve Bannon was just ordered to prison for ignoring a Congressional subpeona.â€” Libs of TikTok (@libsoftiktok)
Hunter Biden ignored a subpeona for months and wasnâ€™t sentenced to prison.
[pic.twitter.com/D18aXuTKT8] [June 6, 2024]
A judge just sent Steve Bannon to prison for ignoring a congressional subpoena.â€” End Wokeness (@EndWokeness)
Hunter did the same thing. No prison.
Fauci lied under oath. No prison.
[pic.twitter.com/8i0118diXD] [June 6, 2024]
And all we'll hear from the mainstream media is how Donald Trump, if re-elected, will abuse his power to prosecute and jail his political opponents.
Steve Bannon was ordered to report to prison on July 1. This is another egregious example of the third-world weaponization of our justice system that Joe Biden has used to silence his opponents since day one. Biden retaliates against American citizens he disagrees with by turningâ€¦â€” Attorney General Ken Paxton (@KenPaxtonTX)
 [June 6, 2024]
Biden retaliates against American citizens he disagrees with by turning them into political prisoners. The country is becoming unrecognizable. This cannot continue.
It's some coincidence that a World War II veteran told a reporter today on the anniversary of D-Day that he doesn't recognize the country anymore.
Will Merrick Garland go to prison for contempt?â€” Kasia Z. Zasada ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ðŸ‡µðŸ‡± (@ZuzaZasada)
We all know the answer.
[June 6, 2024]
Garland was held in contempt of Congress for refusing to turn over the Robert Hur recordings.
This is disgraceful. Itâ€™s time for Republicans to unite and fight back against this lawfare.â€” J.D. Vance (@JDVance1)
 [June 6, 2024]
Bannon gets prison time, while Hunter and Fauci walk free. Justice should be blind, not selective. This just shows how the system is rigged against those who challenge the establishment.â€” MAG2A us (@armsparts2)
[June 6, 2024]
Eric Holder (Obama official) did the same thingâ€” Joshua Robinson (@JRobFreedom)
[June 6, 2024]
How long did Eric Holder spend in prison?
â€œNo one is above the lawâ€â€” Jack (@jackunheard)
[June 6, 2024]
Hunter Biden made a spectacle of holding a press conference on the steps of the Capitol where he was supposed to be testifying. It couldn't be any more in-your-face if they tried.
You see the double standards.â€” floridanow1 (@floridanow1)
90% of Congress ignores the double standards.
Media applauds and covers for the double standard.
[June 6, 2024]
Ok so everybody who did the same thing needs to immediately go to prison. Surely there is a list somewhere, lolâ€” Mild Mannered Maniac (@80sGeek)
[June 6, 2024]
Time to DISMANTLE the DOJ.â€” Nick Sortor (@nicksortor)
Itâ€™s corrupt to the core and completely unfixable.
[June 6, 2024]
Remember this when the left says "There isn't a two tiered system of justice, Hunter is on trial!" ðŸ¤¡â€” AMAC (@AMACforAmerica)
[June 6, 2024]
And will get a slap on the wrist, told to stay off crack, and walk free.
Defund the DOJ. It only serves to persecute innocent conservatives.â€” Paul A. Szypula ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@Bubblebathgirl)
The DOJ does not represent the interests of all American people.
[June 6, 2024]
They're not even hiding the bias anymore. I think they're doing it on purpose because their base loves it. But it's not going to win them anymore voters!â€” Lorrie Ann ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡²ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡²ðŸ‡ºðŸ‡¸ (@LorrieAnn25)
[June 6, 2024]
Independents see the double standard.
This is how a banana republic looks, kidsâ€” Iron Range Rocks and Cows (@angry_ande)
[June 6, 2024]
I'm starting to see a pattern here...â€” Nick Charles (@ThinMan69)
[June 6, 2024]
what a coincidence that they would silence Bannon just before the election.â€” Swabby McSweetie (@SwabbyMcSweetie)
[June 6, 2024]
For what it's worth, Bannon said outside the courthouse that this won't shut him up.
Steve Bannon ordered to surrender to prison by July 1st: "All of this is about one thing, shutting down the MAGA movement, grassroots conservatives and Pres Trump. Not only are we winning, we are going to prevail. Thereâ€™s not a prison or jail built that can shut me up."â€” Real Mac Report (@RealMacReport)
[pic.twitter.com/KhauNS9gV3] [June 6, 2024]
They will jail every Trump surrogate before the election if they get their way.â€” SazzygirlinCali (@RjbRocklin)
[June 6, 2024]
The consensus in the replies seems to be that Eric Holder, Merrick Garland, and Hunter Biden were all held in contempt of Congress and nothing happened to them. This way, they can shut down Bannon's popular podcast for four months during election season.
Here's a longish post to close things out:
Remember, this is a misdemeanor.â€” Jeff Clark (@JeffClarkUS)
For the Biden Administration, if this stands, itâ€™s mission accomplished:
Take Bannon out for close to the full span of the run up to the 2024 presidential election. And even if Trump grants him a pardon later, they canâ€™t give him a time machineâ€¦
 [June 6, 2024]
â€¦ they canâ€™t give him a time machine to undo time already spent under lock and key.
Think about where that leaves the country.
The Supreme Court needs to intervene in this attempt to shut down a key voice before the election. And they can do a lot simply by granting a stay pending resolution of a cert petition and then Bannon could stay free until late September at least.
Iâ€™m sure Bannonâ€™s lawyers have their cert petition up on the drafting table now. (The DC Circuit likely will deny a stay.)
And the Supreme Court should go farther and grant cert in their pre-October Term 2024 orders list at the end of the Summer. The DC Circuitâ€™s Licavoli decision should be reversed and the Supreme Court should use this occasion to reinforce that lower courts cannot empty the word â€œwillfullyâ€ of all meaning.
***

author: Reuters
title: Three Christian missionaries from Oklahoma-based group killed in Haiti By Reuters
text:
By Brendan O'Brien
(Reuters) - Three Christian missionaries from Missions in Haiti were shot and killed in an ambush by a gang in Haiti, the Oklahoma-based group said on Friday.
The missionaries were taking shelter in a house when gang members began shooting at the residence at about 9 p.m. CDT (0200 GMT) Thursday, the group said in two Facebook (NASDAQ: META ) posts.
Months of gang violence in Haiti have forced the government into retreat, and U.S. Secretary of State Antony Blinken has warned the country is close to becoming a failed state.
Haitiâ€™s main international airport in Port-au-Prince reopened this week, nearly three months after it shut due to deadly gang-related violence. But gangs still control much of the capital and Haiti's main seaport remains closed.
"Unfortunately, this serves as a reminder that the security situation in Haiti cannot wait â€“ too many innocent lives are being lost," State Department spokesman Matthew Miller said in a statement.
Missouri State Representative Ben Baker said his daughter Natalie Lloyd and son-in-law Davy Lloyd were killed while working as full-time missionaries. Davy Lloyd was the son of the organization's founders, David and Alicia Lloyd, who started it in 2000.
The identity of the third person killed has not been released.
"My heart is broken in a thousand pieces. Iâ€™ve never felt this kind of pain," Baker said on Facebook.
Missions in Haiti said the couple was leaving a church when they were ambushed by three trucks full of gang members. They took Davy Lloyd to a house, tied him up and beat him, before taking the group's trucks and some items and left, it said.
"Another gang came after to see what was going on and if they could help, so they say," the organization said. "No one understood what they were doing, not sure what took place but one was shot and killed and now this gang went into full attack mode."
The couple and another individual identified as Jude called a leader of the organization on a satellite phone and said that their lives were in danger.
Three Christian missionaries from Oklahoma-based group killed in Haiti

author: COLlive Editor
title: Live: Evening of Inspiration to Mark Chof Daled Teves in Montreal
text:
A special Chof Daled Teves event will take place in Montreal, Canada to mark the Alter Rebbeâ€™s Yartzeit and the Yartzeit of the the Mashpia and Kabbalist Reb Volf Greenglass OBM.
Rabbi Greenglass, a devoted Shliach of the previous Lubavitcher Rebbe and the Rebbe, was a beloved educator who merited to inculcate Chasidic values and Chabad Chasidus teachings to over 3 generations of students.
In his honor, the family and many of the Montreal institutions are organizing a beautiful event, with guest keynote speaker, Rabbi Shmuel Lew, Shliach in London, England.
The public is invited to watch this evening of chizuk prayer for Eretz Yisrael and inspiring farbrengen live on COLive.com and at REBVOLF.COM.
LIVE
The book about Reb Volf Greenglass, containing many of Reb Volfâ€™s farbrengen stories, Minhagim, and teachings, has recently been published in English.
After many years of hard work, a team of dedicated editors translated the book of Rabbi Greenglass into English. This English translation will allow the English-speaking public to learn and savor the wisdom and dedication of this unique chassidishe personality of our generation.
The book can be pre-purchased online at REBVOLF.COM or at your local Hebrew book store in the near future.
Rabbi Menachem Zev Greenglass (halevi) was originally born to a non-Chabad family in the Polish town of Krasnik, near Lublin, and was sent to learn in the Chabad Yeshiva Tomchei Tmimim in Lodge and Otwock where he acquired his vast knowledge in Torah, Kabbalah and Chassidus.
After fleeing Nazi-occupied Europe to Shanghai, China, Rabbi Greenglass traveled from there to Montreal, Canada, as one of the 9 shluchim sent by the Previous Lubavitcher Rebbe, Rabbi Yosef Yitzchak Schneersohn, to cultivate the Jewish community.
Their first achievement was establishing the Rabbinical College of Canada, also known as Yeshiva Tomchei Tmimim. Thousands of students from nonobservant families got the taste and love for Judaism in the school. they became the many Torah observant grandparents of todayâ€™s frum community.
Rabbi Greenglass, or Reb Volf, was soon appointed as the Head Mashpia and spent many years teaching and inspiring thousands of Lubavitch students who went on to become shluchim, community leaders, and chassidishe yungeleit and professionals around the world.
He was known to say, â€œYou should never â€˜put downâ€™ (criticize) a student, you should â€˜elevateâ€™ him, and show him his unlimited positive potentials.â€
Together with his longtime friend Rabbi Leibel Groner obm, who served as the Rebbeâ€™s secretary, he made the first attempt to document Chabad customs in the monumental book â€œSefer Haminhagim.â€
In Montreal, he was always referred to by members of the Jewish community as a Tzaddik and a Malach (a righteous man and an angel). The Rebbe once called him â€œmy Mekubal (Kabbalist).â€

author: Ashley Lopez
title: Nikki Haley didn't say slavery caused the Civil War. Now she's facing major backlash | WBFO
text: Nikki Haley didn't say slavery caused the Civil War. Now she's facing major backlash Former South Carolina Gov. Nikki Haley is facing significant backlash after failing to mention slavery as a driving force behind the Civil War during a campaign stop in New Hampshire. At an event on Wednesday, a voter asked Haley: "what was the cause of the United States Civil War?" She replied that the cause "was basically how government was going to run, the freedoms, and what people could and couldn't do." "I think it always comes down to the role of government and what the rights of the people are," Haley continued. "And I will always stand by the fact that, I think, government was intended to secure the rights and freedoms of the people." After Haley gave her answer, the voter told her that it was "astonishing" that she gave an answer "without mentioning the word 'slavery.'" Last night, [President Biden](https://twitter.com/JoeBiden/status/1740221284284256645?) said on X in response to a video of this exchange that the Civil War was indeed "about slavery." It was about slavery.â€” Joe Biden (@JoeBiden) [https://t.co/q9bTDvtPne] [December 28, 2023] During an interview with a local radio station on Thursday, Haley addressed what happened. "Of course the Civil War was about slavery," she said. "We know that. That's the easy part of it." Haley explained that she was interested in talking about what lessons should be drawn from the Civil War and defended her answer to the voter. "I know it's about slavery," she said. "I am from the South." Haley has a [complicated history](https://www.npr.org/2023/02/15/1157122486/nikki-haley-confederate-flag-race-president-2024) when it comes to issues of race. As a woman of color, her campaign was angling to strike a different tone on issues of race and identity â€“ especially in comparison to her chief rival in the GOP primary, former President Donald Trump. As South Carolina's governor, Haley ordered the confederate flag be removed from the grounds of the state capitol following the 2015 shooting of Black parishioners at a church in Charleston in 2015. Haley also [condemned Trump](https://www.politico.com/news/2020/08/25/haley-trump-charlottesville-comments-401587) following the racist and antisemitic gathering in Charlottesville, Va., in 2017. (She also served as U.N. ambassador to Trump from 2017 to 2018.) The Republican Party, though, has been striking an overall different tone when it comes to issues of race and the country's history with slavery and white supremacy. Republican governors, including some of Haley's rivals in the race, have been [eliminating](https://www.npr.org/2023/05/15/1176210007/florida-ron-desantis-dei-ban-diversity) diversity and inclusion efforts in higher education, as well as [banning books](https://www.wusf.org/education/2023-06-01/politifact-fl-desantis-said-not-a-single-book-was-banned-districts-have-removed-dozens) that are about race. Backlash to Haley's comments comes less than three weeks before Republican voters start voting in early primary states. The Iowa caucus, the first primary contest, is Jan. 15. Haley's campaign, in particular, has had a surprising amount of momentum in the last several months. The once crowded field of presidential hopefuls has been shrinking ahead of early state elections but Haley has been one of the few candidates actually gaining more support. Just this week, there have been reports that Florida Gov. Ron DeSantis' campaign is [struggling](https://www.nytimes.com/2023/12/24/us/politics/desantis.html) and businessman Vivek Ramaswamy has [cut TV ad spending](https://www.npr.org/2023/12/27/1221828944/vivek-ramaswamys-campaign-has-slowed-tv-ad-spending-ahead-of-the-iowa-caucus). Trump has had a commanding lead in the polls in early states and nationally. Haley, however, has been the only candidate in the primary that has presented any sort of challenge for the former president. Haley routinely polls second or third in early state polling and performs well when in head-to-head polling with Biden. Copyright 2023 NPR. To see more, visit https://www.npr.org.

author: @Racingnews365
title: RacingNews365 is hiring â€“ Join F1's fastest-growing website!
text:
RacingNews365, which is present in the F1 paddock throughout the season, amassing more than 350 million combined pageviews per year across its Global and Dutch websites.
Reporting to the Lead Editor, these new roles will be core to maintaining the website's reputation for being a trustworthy source on all things Formula 1 and motorsport, while driving further growth and reach.
The successful applicant(s) should be able to demonstrate a true passion for - and have impressive knowledge of - Formula 1 and other global motorsport series, as well as demonstrating a firm grasp of digital and SEO best practices.
They will be proficient in copy editing and writing, have an eye for detail and be able to work under pressure, whilst also being highly organised team players with widespread experience of working within a team environment.
What we are seeking
Role responsibility
- Work within a tight-knit, remote editorial team to generate high-quality content for the website
- Produce content quickly and accurately on a daily basis, including across F1/motorsport weekends
- Create and nurture relationships that increase exposure of our brand to fans and within the industry
The ideal candidate
Essential skills:
- A demonstrable passion for and excellent knowledge and understanding of F1 and motorsport
- Exceptional organisational skills and attention to detail
- Ability to write copy in line with the highest editorial standards
- Ability to meet tight deadlines under pressure, while prioritising accordingly
- Excellent grasp and understanding of SEO best practices
- Professional approach at all times, whether working remotely or on location
- Ability to work in and contribute to a fun and dynamic team-based environment
Education:
- Ideally educated to degree level, but relevant work experience will also be taken into consideration
- English mother tongue, though knowledge of other â€˜motorsportâ€™ languages a distinct advantage
Professional experience:
- Must have experience of working on a reputable digital platform
- Experience of writing, and possibly commissioning, managing and signing off content
- Experience of writing about F1 preferred, while experience of writing about motorsport is essential
Interested in joining our team?
To apply, please send your CV and recent work examples to info@racingnews365.nl by Monday 15, January.
We look forward to hearing from you!
Only applications from short-listed candidates will be acknowledged

author: Valley City Times-Record
title: Choicese (CHC-SES) Drives Financial Digitization, Enhancing Financial Inclusion | User | times-online.com
text: In a major collaboration, Choicese (CHC-SES), the internationally renowned investment platform, has announced a strategic partnership with a leading brokerage firm to introduce stock trading services. By combining their expertise and resources, Choicese (CHC-SES) aims to provide investors with a convenient and secure stock trading platform, enabling them to participate in the stock market and embark on new investment journeys. This collaboration will further drive the development of the stock market, offering investors more options and increasing investment opportunities. With the booming stock market, an increasing number of investors are eager to participate in stock trading, seeking the opportunities and returns it offers. To meet this demand, Choicese (CHC-SES) has partnered with a well-known brokerage firm to launch stock trading services, providing investors with a convenient and secure trading platform. Through its collaboration with brokerage firms, Choicese (CHC-SES) has expanded its service range, enabling investors to trade stocks on the same platform. Investors can easily access the stock market through the Choicese (CHC-SES) app or online platform, executing buy and sell orders. This seamless integration offers investors a more convenient trading experience, saving time and effort. Additionally, the collaboration with brokerage firms brings more trading tools and features to Choicese (CHC-SES). Investors can access real-time market data, stock analysis, and research reports through the Choicese (CHC-SES) trading platform, aiding them in making informed investment decisions. The platform also provides trade execution and settlement services, ensuring the security and efficiency of the transaction process. This partnership positively impacts the development of the stock market. The global influence of Choicese (CHC-SES) combined with the brokerage firms' expertise will provide investors with more investment options and opportunities. Investors can choose stock trading strategies that suit their investment goals and risk tolerance, engaging in market fluctuations. The introduction of stock trading services will further promote the development of the stock market, increasing market liquidity and activity. Investors will be able to invest more flexibly, seizing more investment opportunities. Choicese (CHC-SES) will continue to collaborate with brokerage firms, offering investors more comprehensive and convenient investment services, collectively fostering the prosperity and sustainable development of the stock market. Disclaimer: The information provided in this press release is not a solicitation for investment, or intended as investment advice, financial advice, or trading advice. It is strongly recommended that you practice due diligence (including consultation with a professional financial advisor) before investing in or trading securities and cryptocurrency. Media Contact Company Name: Choice Equity Broking Private Limited Contact Person: Deepika Singhvi Email: Send Email Country: India Website: https://choiceses-india.com

author: Al Jazeera
title: â€˜No joy in our heartsâ€™: Bethlehemâ€™s Christians face heartbreak at Christmas - Al Jazeera English
text: â€˜No joy in our heartsâ€™: Bethlehemâ€™s Christians face heartbreak at Christmas Unlike other Christmases, 87-year-old Noha Helmi Taraziâ€™s family wonâ€™t be visiting her. Israeli bombs killed her sister and brother in Gaza, and maimed another sister. Bethlehem, occupied West Bank â€“ At Christmas, Noha Helmi Tarazi normally decorates her home with a large tree, which she describes as a symbol of light and joy. The 87-year-old prepares the house for her family, who gather here each year, and makes Christmas sweets and large, festive meals. She usually places presents under the Christmas tree for her grandchildren, taking care to wrap them and label them with their names. Keep readinglist of 4 items [â€˜Massacreâ€™ in Gaza: Israeli strikes on Maghazi camp kill 70 Palestinians](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/liveblog/2023/12/25/israel-hamas-war-live-intense-israeli-strikes-hit-al-bureij-and-al-maghazi?traffic_source=KeepReading) [Israeli forces â€˜massacreâ€™ at least 70 in Gazaâ€™s Maghazi refugee camp](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/12/24/israeli-forces-massacre-at-least-70-people-in-gazas-maghazi-refugee-camp?traffic_source=KeepReading) [â€˜Our hearts in Bethlehemâ€™, says Pope in Christmas Eve mass, shadowed by war](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/12/24/our-hearts-in-bethlehem-pope-says-in-christmas-eve-mass-shadowed-by-war?traffic_source=KeepReading) This year, no one will gather in her home. Even the children do not feel like celebrating, she says. â€œThere is no joy left in our hearts,â€ she says. In the birthplace of Jesus Christ, the celebrations for Christmas are on hold. The [decision to cancel Christmas](https://www.aljazeera.com/features/2023/12/22/without-work-and-hope-bethlehems-christmas-economy-bleeds-from-gaza-war) has not been taken lightly, but it is one the church and community here are all united on, to show their solidarity with the Palestinians facing Israeli bombardment and a total siege in the Gaza Strip. Israeli bombing and artillery fire have killed [more than 20,000 people](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/longform/2023/10/9/israel-hamas-war-in-maps-and-charts-live-tracker) in Gaza since the war began on October 7, including at least 8,000 children. More than 300 people have been killed in the occupied West Bank, too, either by Israeli soldiers or by settlers who often attack with cover from Israeli troops. The war has brought Bethlehemâ€™s tourism â€“ a bedrock of its economy â€“ to a standstill at the time of the year when it usually peaks. Where visitors from around the world would usually throng Bethlehemâ€™s markets around Christmas, the streets are empty this year. But even if tourists were around, thereâ€™s no festivity among the residents of Bethlehem, many of whom have close family members in Gaza. â€œHow can we celebrate Christmas in the midst of this genocidal war?â€ asks Tarazi, known to those close to her as Um Shadi. â€œHow can we celebrate when people in Gaza struggle to get even one meal a day?â€ The images and news of the suffering in Gaza under Israelâ€™s relentless bombardment and ground invasion are too much for her. Um Shadi, whose family lives in Gaza City, says she has been particularly disturbed by videos of people fleeing towards the sea and being forced to boil seawater to make it drinkable. She grew up in the Remal neighbourhood of Gaza City and lived there through her 20s during the 1960s. She has â€œbeautiful memories of the seaâ€, where she used to swim at night. People lived in peace, she says. Life became harder after she graduated with a degree in English literature from Cairo University in 1967. She was unable to return to Gaza because it was occupied by Israel that year, and instead, she spent the next 10 years in Libya, where her brothers also lived and where she met her husband. She eventually returned to the occupied West Bank, where she made her home and built her Christmas rituals with her family â€“ traditions she will skip this year. â€˜This Christmas, may God have mercy on themâ€™ All signs of Christmas have disappeared from the streets and homes of Bethlehem. Usually, people flock to [Manger Square](https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2023/12/7/if-christ-were-born-today-he-would-be-born-under-rubble-israeli-bombing), which is adorned with decorations, to watch fireworks. None of that will happen this year. Lots of people in Bethlehem and the surrounding area have relatives in Gaza. Um Shadi herself has lost a brother and a sister since the war began. Her brother died on October 17 after being unable to receive a life-saving gallbladder operation because of the aerial bombardment of hospitals in the Strip. Just a few days later, one of her sisters died in an [air strike](https://www.aljazeera.com/features/2023/10/20/we-were-baptised-here-and-we-will-die-here-gazas-oldest-church-bombed) on St Porphyrius Greek Orthodox Church, where the family had taken shelter. Another sister lost a leg during the same bombardment. It has always been difficult to see her family, even before the war, but now she can barely even speak to them because of the [telecommunications blackouts](https://www.aljazeera.com/features/2023/12/21/led-by-plumes-of-smoke-how-gazas-first-responders-navigate-a-blackout#:~:text=On%20at%20least%20five%20occasions,defence%20teams%20amid%20heavy%20bombardment.) in Gaza. Um Shadi was unable to attend another sisterâ€™s funeral in the enclave before the war because she was not granted a permit to travel there. Instead, her niece had to take a video of the ceremony for her. In happier years, some Christians from Gaza had been able to obtain permits from the Israeli authorities to travel from Gaza to Bethlehem at Christmas â€“ something her sisters and her friend Rose often did, she says. â€œMy sisters used to visit me, and I say this year on Christmas, may God have mercy on them.â€ The agony of not being able to communicate with her family in Gaza is unbearable, she adds. It has brought her to â€œthe brink of despairâ€. Christmas used to be the one joyful event that everyone could count on each year, Um Shadi says. Now, that has gone, too.

author: Prasun Choudhari
title: Flight operations from Amritsar, Guwahati lucknow and Chandigarh affected due to dense fog, IndiGo issues travel advisory
text: Flight operations from Amritsar, Guwahati and Chandigarh has been affected due to dense fog conditions following which the IndiGo airlines has issued a travel advisory for passengers. In a post on X, IndiGo airlines said, Weather in Amritsar, Chandigarh and Guwahati remains much the same, continuing to impact flight schedules. It said, Please keep a tab on your flight status. Meanwhile, the DGCA officials said thatflight to/from Delhi, Guwahati, Chandigarh, Amritsar, Leh, Khajuraho, Srinagar, Lucknow were disrupted due to dense fog. #6ETravelAsvisory: As weather conditions in #Delhi, #Guwahati & #Chandigarh are yet to improve, we recommend customers to continue monitoring their flight status for the latest updates https://t.co/IEBbuCsa3e. IndiGo (@IndiGo6E) January 3, 2025 Sources from Delhi ATC also confirmed that the condition is foggy in Delhi leading to multiple disruptions The operations at the Mumbai airport is not affected due to these delays but the initial delays will cause a cascading effect will will lead to certain delays to flight operating to/from Mumbai as the inbound aircraft will itself be delayed, the officials said.

author: Canadian Press
title: Another death reported since 2021 recall of home bed assist handles: Health Canada
text:
OTTAWA â€” Health Canada is reminding Canadians about a recall of home bed assist handles after learning of an additional death.
Four models of bed handles distributed by Drive Medical were first recalled two years ago after two reported deaths â€” one in Canada and one in the U.S.
Health Canada says as of Dec. 19, the company has received a report of a second death in this country.
The metal handles are affixed alongside the mattress to help people get in and out of their regular bed at home. The products are not designed for hospital beds.
Health Canada says more than 68,000 of the affected handles were sold between 2016 and 2021 in Canada.
It says consumers should stop using them and contact Drive Medical Canada to get a refund.
The recalled home bed assist model numbers are 15064, 15062, RTL15073 and RTL15063-ADJ.
No information has been provided about what caused any of the deaths, but the recall notice says that retention straps were not properly secured in the initial cases in Canada and the U.S.
Drive Medical has also learned of an additional three deaths in the U.S. that happened before Dec. 6, 2021, when the recall was first issued.
More than 496,000 of the bed assist products were distributed in the U.S. between 2007 and 2021. The products were sold on Amazon.
This report by The Canadian Press was first published Dec. 28, 2023.
Canadian Press health coverage receives support through a partnership with the Canadian Medical Association. CP is solely responsible for this content.
The Canadian Press
